hide-scrollbar-but-keep-scrolling-behavi.title: Hide Scrollbar but keep Scrolling behavior in CSS
hide-scrollbar-but-keep-scrolling-behavi.description: Learn how to hide a scrollbar without removing the scrolling behavior in CSS.
hide-scrollbar-but-keep-scrolling-behavi.content:
In some designs, you may want content to overflow and scroll — but without showing the scrollbar itself. This is common in modern UI layouts where space is limited or where you want a clean, immersive feel. ## HTML example Let create the `div` that will act as a scrollable container and add the class `no-scrollbar`: ```html
``` And this how it looks right now: ![Overflow with a scrollbar](./images/overflow-with-scrollbar.png 'Overflow with a scrollbar') ## CSS styling Paste this snippet to your style's file to remove a scrollbar while preserving a scrolling behavior: ```css .no-scrollbar { -ms-overflow-style: none; scrollbar-width: none; } .no-scrollbar::-webkit-scrollbar { display: none; } ``` And this is our result: ![Overflow without a scrollbar](./images/overflow-without-scrollbar.gif 'Overflow without a scrollbar') ## Compatibility | Browser | Compatible | |:--- |:---:| | Chrome | ✅ | | Edge | ✅ | | Firefox | ✅ | | Safari | ✅ | | Internet Explorer | ✅ | | Opera | ✅ | All major browsers support this technique. Internet Explorer and some old Edge versions rely on `-ms-overflow-style: none`, while modern engines use either `scrollbar-width: none` (Firefox) or the `::-webkit-scrollbar` pseudo-element (Chromium and Safari).
